lines.text:
[Speaking of Porter]
As an instructor it was his job to chew midshipmen off, and just between us, you gave him plenty of cause.
When a man's religion is the book of Navy regulations, he gotta be sour inside, and your captain's a very sour man, Mr. Link.

[to his crew]
Gentlemen, we are now a ship without a country.
I don't envy you, Mr. Farragut. You win't be the most popular nan after we ride out this storm - if we ride it out.

[Concerning their bringing the countess with them]
Davy Lad, what's the skipper gonna say about her?
I shudder to think, Link. I shudder to think.
Well, Mr. Link, you're probably witnessing the end of a long and honorable naval career.
Yes, sir! But what away to go, sir!
I'm afraid there's a limit to nobility... even for Americans.
